results.headline: LOVE AT LARGE (MOVIE)
results.summary_short: Private eye, mesmerizing beauty and various oddballs. Sleek tongue-in-cheek stuff.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Love at Large

results.headline: JOE VERSUS THE VOLCANO (MOVIE)
results.summary_short: Young man with six months to live. Big-budget comedy with flat feet.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Joe Versus the Volcano

results.headline: HOUSE PARTY (MOVIE)
results.summary_short: Teenager's hermetically sealed world. Buoyant, perceptive comedy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of House Party

results.headline: COUPE DE VILLE (MOVIE)
results.summary_short: Three rival brothers drive to Florida. Flavorsome, well-played coming-of-age caper, tho unsurprising.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Coupe de Ville

results.headline: BAD INFLUENCE (MOVIE)
results.summary_short: L.A. yuppie meets insidious charmer. Good, glossy, decadent thriller, till it goes round the bend.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Bad Influence

results.headline: Handmaid's Tale, The (Movie)
results.summary_short: Atwood's police universe of oppressed women. Visually compelling but less than magnetic.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Handmaid's Tale

results.headline: PERFECT MURDER, THE (MOVIE)
results.summary_short: Indian police inspector and Swedish colleague on murder case in Bombay. Mild mystery, loaded with overacting.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Perfect Murder

results.headline: DRIVING ME CRAZY (MOVIE)
results.summary_short: L.A. crooks steal East German inventor's car fueled by turnip juice.

results.headline: HUNT FOR RED OCTOBER, THE (MOVIE)
results.summary_short: Soviet sub captain with plan. O.K. suspense, but novel was better.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Hunt for Red October

results.headline: Basket Case 2 (Movie)
results.summary_short: Grotesque rides again. Not bad as cheap horror spoofs go. But runs out of gas, to thinning humor.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Basket Case 2

results.headline: WHERE THE HEART IS (MOVIE)
results.summary_short: Wiped-out tycoon and grown children in Brooklyn tenement. Wildly imaginative, thoroughly incoherent.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Where the Heart Is

results.headline: MOUNTAINS OF THE MOON (MOVIE)
results.summary_short: Victorian eccentrics Burton and Speke, exploring and feuding. Evocative but no real dramatic shape, faulty casting.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mountains of the Moon

results.headline: ROSALIE GOES SHOPPING (MOVIE)
results.summary_short: Queen-sized material girl loose at the mall. Offbeat and merrily unpredictable, with a magical Marianne.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Rosalie Goes Shopping

results.headline: BLOOD OF HEROES, THE (MOVIE)
results.summary_short: Gladiators in futuristic Dark Age. Good, lean variation on the post-apocalypse thriller.

results.headline: NIGHTBREED (MOVIE)
results.summary_short: Man tries to join monsters his psychiatrist wants to destroy.

results.headline: MADHOUSE (MOVIE)
results.summary_short: Relative-bashing in yuppie couple's new home. Cheerfully mean-spirited comedy.

results.headline: REVENGE (MOTION PICTURES)
results.summary_short: Ex-Navy pilot in hot water, in Mexico. Slow-paced, emotionally vacant and wildly ornate.

results.headline: COURAGE MOUNTAIN (MOVIE)
results.summary_short: Teen-age Heidi leaves her grandpa and boyfriend in Alps for school in World War I Italy.
